subject: Pro X Ultra Control Box
description_text:
Hi there, my Pro X Ultra Pedal Control Box does not connect to the brake. I
have to plug the brake pedal into the clutch pedal port to get it to work,
so the brake pedal port on the box is not working properly.

*PAUL GALL*
Pogo Pro Films <https://www.pogoprofilms.com/>
224-538-8530

conversations.body_text: Hi，Pogo Pro Films，  Have you updated the SIMSONN Manager to version 2.0.9? Then, update the ProX Ultra firmware to version 2.0.2. After that, use the Offset function to reset the progress bar back to 0%. Once these steps are completed, please test again.

Hi, it is the latest version. Whatever is plugged in to the brake port does
not get recognized.

*PAUL GALL*
Pogo Pro Films <https://www.pogoprofilms.com/>
224-538-8530


On Wed, Jul 23, 2025 at 8:55 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi Pogo Pro Films,    You can try using the Offset function to reset the percentage to zero. If it still doesn’t work, we will arrange to send you a replacement control box. It’s unlikely to be damaged, as every unit is fully tested and calibrated before shipping.

Yes it still doesn’t work. The brake port just does not recognize that
anything is plugged in to it. I also just updated to the most recent
firmware and it is the same. It is an issue with the hardware.

*PAUL GALL*
Pogo Pro Films <https://www.pogoprofilms.com/>
224-538-8530


On Fri, Jul 25, 2025 at 8:07 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi Pogo Pro Films,  May I assist you remotely to check the issue? This will help avoid the situation where a replacement control box is sent but the problem remains unresolved, which could waste your time. Please install ToDesk (no registration required), and we can schedule a time for a remote check as the final confirmation.

I apologize for the late response. Yes, I can do this.

On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 10:55 AM support@simsonn.com
Hi Pogo Pro Films,  Please let me know which country you are in and how many hours from now you will be available. I will coordinate the time to assist you with a remote inspection.

I am in Chicago, IL, USA. I should be available any time from 8pm to 11pm
CST most nights.

On Wed, Aug 6, 2025 at 9:19 AM support@simsonn.com
Hi Pogo Pro Films,  I will contact you in 10 hours, which will be exactly 9:00 AM China time.

I have the app installed and I also realized that I have the Simsonn Pro X,
not the Ultra. But it is still not recognizing anything in the brake pedal
location after updating everything.

On Sat, Aug 9, 2025 at 10:17 AM support@simsonn.com
Hi Pogo Pro Films,  Are you available now?
Hi Pogo Pro Films, Please provide your ID and temporary password, and I can assist you in resolving the issue right now.

Hi Pogo Pro Films,  You can provide your order number and a photo of your pedals, and I can help identify the model. If your ProX pedals were mistakenly updated with the wrong firmware version, press the upgrade button on the control box and reinsert the USB cable. SIMSONN Manager will indicate that it has entered SIMSONN Flasher mode. Then go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Pedals → firmware → prox.sfu to restore the device.

I’m sorry, you told me 10 hours from a certain time and it was over 12
hours from that time. I was already asleep.

I will make sure that they are updated correctly but I’m positive they are
already properly updated. It is a hardware issue, not a software issue.

*PAUL GALL*
Pogo Pro Films <https://www.pogoprofilms.com/>
224-538-8530


On Sat, Aug 9, 2025 at 10:24 PM support@simsonn.com
Hi Pogo Pro Films,  Are you available now? I can check it for you remotely.

Hi Pogo Pro Films,    Have you tried using the offset function? When replacing the control box, it’s necessary to reset the factory dead-zone position; otherwise, the signal might not be detected. Also, since your brake worked when plugged into the clutch port earlier, it indicates that the brake itself is fine, and a brand-new control box is very unlikely to be faulty. This means it’s most likely that the offset hasn’t been set, or there’s an installation issue with the brake.  Please send me photos of the brake pedal from the side and all around, as well as of the control box, so I can check. Normally, the calibration process shouldn’t be this troublesome.
